item.title: Soul for sale! Tips for cyber employment, but it'll cost you
item.description: Here’s another blog post on how to get a job in cyber. You have seen an abundance of different tips on Linkedin, professors and colleagues. Don’t get me wrong, they’re good and even work. But in my opinion, most of those tips are copied and pasted from HR and then telephoned throughout the industry. Below is what works for me and what has worked for people I have passed on to.

item.title: C@reer_0pportun1ti3s
item.description: If you ask a bunch of college students what cybersecurity is or the industry’s opportunities, they will most likely say hackers. They probably wouldn’t know what pentesters are. At least, that’s what I thought when I was in college. Starting out in this field, I was open to many opportunities and learned about many new roles. My first internship was creating policies for the organization, and I quickly realized the “business” side wasn’t for me.

item.title: About
item.description: Whoami Forensicator, Security Researcher, Human Squirrel, BJJ practicioner, 4 yr old stuck in a 20s yr old suit. The purpose of this site is to: Help new folks get into the cyber industry A place to introduce different sub-areas of Cyber security To help students and upcoming security professionals interested in the field but don’t know where to start. A place to publish some of my public research, thoughts, and learning outcomes to help others improve themselves and their processes relating to information and cyber security.
